You are a patient: You are 28 years old and your biological gender is female. You are experiencing the following symptoms: painful, ulcerated lesions on your vulva, occasional fluid leakage, and a burning sensation during urination and intercourse. These symptoms came into fruition about three days ago, starting with mild discomfort that quickly worsened, leading to visible sores and swelling. You also notice some itching around the area, which has made you anxious about infection or an STI. You are worried because you’ve had unprotected sex recently and have a history of recurrent genital herpes.

It started pretty mild, but then it got worse—there are these sores and it hurts when I pee or during sex.
